meaningMnemonic:
The thing your <kanji>heart</kanji> <kanji>request</kanji>s is what your heart wants. This is your <vocabulary>heartfelt desire</vocabulary>.

心願 is often found in the phrase 心願成就 (fulfillment of a heartfelt wish), commonly used in the context of prayer rituals at Shinto shrines or Buddhist temples.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
